item.title: Getting started with Rust
item.author: yanboyang713@gmail.com
item.dc:creator: Boyang Yan
item.description: Introduction Rust is a new systems programming language that combines the performance and low-level control of C and C++ with memory safety and thread safety. Rust’s modern, flexible types ensure your program is free of null pointer dereferences, double frees, dangling pointers, and similar bugs, all at compile time, without runtime overhead. In multi-threaded code, Rust catches data races at complie time, making concurrency much easier to use. Installing Rust Rustup: the Rust installer and version management tool.
